answers.author: Cory Fleming
answers.text:
When the FCC authorized the 311 number back in the mid-1990's, the reduction of 911 calls was one of the big goals.  At the time, 911 systems were being swamped with non-emergency and non-life threatening phone calls.   
The U.S. Department of Justice's Office for Community Oriented Policing (COPS Office) has some relevant fact sheets that I think you will find useful.  Their address is:  http://cops.usdoj.gov/RIC/ResourceSearch.aspx  and search on "311."  
Also, the 311 Synergy Group recently held a webinar on the link between 911-311, and I'd be happy to send you those slides.

Also, the 311 Synergy Group recently held a webinar on the link between 911-311, and I'd be happy to send you those slides.

author: Jennifer Smith
text: Have you seen examples of reducing calls into 911 (or said another way: of reducing the non-emergency calls going into 911) through the implementation of 311? Quantitative examples/measurement helpful, if you have it. Thanks!
title: 311 helping reduce 911 calls ?
